title: 之前寫錯咗，正式名稱原來係「與芬尼學英語」

replies.msg:
為咗表示歉意我哋就一齊拜讀佢嘅一篇文章



Students spend the time that they could have spent on regurgitation rather than on understanding how English actually works.
睇咗幾次都不理解the time that could have spent在這裡的作用

Students are more concerned with what is the correct language rather than what feels right and what reads beautiful.
首先，佢想講concerned with還是about？兩個意思不同。同埋有甚麼問題？correctness=makes you sound more educated。第三，我不相信有西人會寫concerned with what is correct language 這結構

Students are rarely encouraged to work on and inculcate their higher-order thinking
學生自己inculcate自己？同埋如何證明英文堂做唔到這樣野？

Teachers either don’t have the time, resources, permission, or expertise (cultural, literary and general knowledge)
嗱！佢自己都睇唔起香港本地英文老師㗎！

Students believe that they should learn words and expressions by memorization rather than creation. Many of them don’t feel comfortable learning a phrase or a word by trial and error.
甚麼是learn words by creation？是指meaningful production？為何這個creation比memorization好？ 其實背誦唔係錯，不過學生要的是context和製造output的機會。

Students see English as a subject that they have to study, rather than a skill that they can practise.
study和practise同樣重要，尤其是底仔冇咁好更加需要大量studying，缺乏input嘅情況下練習只會冇自信

Students feel the pressure to learn English to survive in the education market as commodities
我真心覺得唔需要所有學生愛上外語，坦白講對唔少人語言只係一種工具

原文https://medium.com/@tiffanysuen/whats-wrong-with-hong-kongs-english-education-14bf7d0ca73f
太差喇篇嘢，完全係誤人子弟。。

篇文太差，真係冇資格教人
睇得出少寫文，用字生硬兼唔識用；中文唔識表達就查字典搬隻字落去
太多rather than，係咁重複

Students are encouraged by star tutors to sprinkle stock phrases and expressions onto their writing so as to impress examiners. Students spend the time that they could have spent on regurgitation rather than on understanding how English actually works.
呢句錯得好緊要，因為睇翻on既位置，加翻省略左既字會變為：
Students spend the time that they could have spent on regurgitation rather than could have spent on understanding how English actually works.
會變左意思錯，因為or後半句既on會對應上半句既on
我估佢既意思係：
Students shouldn't waste time on how English works but should focus on regurgitation.
但我都唔係好明佢既論點，因為根據字典，regurgitation係The repetition of information without analysis or comprehension.
https://www.lexico.com/definition/regurgitation
即係鼓勵人地不求甚解？

Students are more concerned with what is the correct language rather than what feels right and what reads beautiful.
呢句好生硬難明，我估佢想講：
Students are too afraid to make mistakes. Be natural and speak your mind.

Students have little appreciation for the English language as an art.
Students are rarely encouraged to work on and inculcate their higher-order thinking skills such as imagination, creativity and critical thinking.
inculcate用法錯誤，中文係灌輸，用翻中文諗就知錯咩
佢應該想講：
Students seldom imagine, create and think independently.

They have ever only been taught to distinguish right and wrong.
係咪兩隻字次序倒轉左？等高手解答

Teachers either don’t have the time, resources, permission, or expertise (cultural, literary and general knowledge) to
either只可以跟兩樣野，either A or B

foster real and two-way interchange among students. They resort to imparting knowledge through lecturing,
to make English lessons interesting, engaging or even exciting.
inter已經有two-way既意思，係咪應該講mutual communication?
resort to係貶意，暗指lecturing係唔恰當既教學方式
慣常寫法係之後個名詞本身都係貶意，例如violence
我覺得似作者唔知resort to係貶意

Students are obsessed with hacks, skills, and formulae that will allow them to locate the right answer and figure out the ‘best’ way to answer a question as if there were one.
Students are often trained to locate information in a piece of writing only, rather than to analyze and appreciate its style of delivery and presentation.
Students are not inspired to immerse themselves in the cultures of English speaking countries. They often learn English from textbooks, rather than real life, or at least from multimedia materials that bear a closer resemblance to real-life interactions.
又係平衡句式既問題，如果唔加at least還好，加左仲難睇得明

Students believe that they should learn words and expressions by memorization rather than creation. Many of them don’t feel comfortable learning a phrase or a word by trial and error.
又係好生硬，尤其第一句。我會寫類似：
Students cram themselves with words and expressions. Instead, they should create their own sentences. Trial and error.

Students either have the misguided notion misconception that they do not have to bother pronouncing a word in a comprehensible way at all or that they must speak in a ‘pure’ RP accent.
Students see English as a subject that they have to study, rather than a skill that they can practise.
Students feel the pressure to learn English to survive in the education market as commodities.
唔係好明，佢係咪想講：
Students are stressed to survive fierce competition.

They never see English as something that’s fun to learn or a life-skill that will allow them to rise up to the various challenges and thrive in life.

replies.msg:
睇到其他人留言，我專登去追咗下你上一個post
其實我大致同意你嘅立場（佢嘅水平的確係有少少問題）
但你自己上一篇又無證據（文科人大忌啦 想persuade但無evidence)
同埋有啲claims都係 講到好過份

首先佢就真係唔係 你所講嘅 香港普通大學生level
佢讀港大法律系，英文最低入學成績係lv5(香港同齡人top 10%)
我唔知佢有無明確講過自己分數，但我印象好似係有5**（同齡人top 1%)
另外讀法律training係會令佢要做好多readings
同埋佢本身都show off到讀過一些文學作品
發音都尚算可以，真係應該有top 0.5%
即係同年的DSE人黎講，6萬人入邊佢英文起碼係 前200-300個個級別
絕對唔係你講嘅「普通大學生level」

第二就係唔多認同你講嘅 要native speaker 或者 near-native competence先喺香港教到英文
non-native speaker當然係無native speaker發音或者語感好
但佢有 廣東話作為母語嘅人 遇到嘅學習困難 同 解決方案
呢啲都唔係native speaker教到（我初學日文時一開始跟咗個日本人，屌出聲，係之後上網搵咗啲 中文教學先明）
當然去到Advanced Level最好係跟返native speaker
但佢嘅level教 lv2 lv3 甚至 lv4 lv5 我覺得都夠做

所以我覺得你係抵屌

當然，以佢水平你話收收埋教書都尚可，但出到YouTube又Podcast咁公開教人，咁就預咗會遇到 高標準嘅critical scrutiny（例如樓主呢挺人去批評佢嘅錯處）
所以，我覺得佢畀人插都幾合理
